citations.narrative:
On May 6th, 2023 during a feeding encounter within the fox enclosure, a male red fox “Todd” bit a 14 year old girl ‘s finger
which was reported to the Utah Division of Wildlife Resources (DWR). The facility was allowing public interactions and
feeding without adequate barriers or direct control of the animals.
Foxes are quick, have sharp teeth and claws and have the potential to cause serious injury to a person.
During public exhibition, animals must be handled so that there is minimal risk of injury or harm to the animal and the
public.
Corrections since this time include removal of feeding as part of public interactions with the remaining fox “Mr. Fox”. The
fox Todd was removed by DWR on May 12th, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1)  Critical
   
Handling of animals. 
On May 6th, 2023 during a feeding encounter within the fox enclosure, a male red fox “Todd” bit a 14 year old girl ‘s finger 
which was reported to the Utah Division of Wildlife Resources (DWR). The facility was allowing public interactions and 
feeding without adequate barriers or direct control of the animals. 
 
Foxes are quick, have sharp teeth and claws and have the potential to cause serious injury to a person.  
 
During public exhibition, animals must be handled so that there is minimal risk of injury or harm to the animal and the 
public.  
 
Corrections since this time include removal of feeding as part of public interactions with the remaining fox “Mr. Fox”. The 
fox Todd was removed by DWR on May 12th, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
